image.altText: A man wears blue PPE overalls and white shoe covers and a mask and needs in the gutter of a road.

items.synopsis: Investigations continue into a crash in the regional Victorian town of Daylesford that left five people dead after a car drove into the beer garden of a busy pub.

title.children: Children among five killed as car crashes into beer garden in regional Victoria

image.altText: Casuarina Prison barbed wire sunset

items.synopsis: Despite repeated warnings and multiple opportunities to intervene, prison authorities failed to prevent 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd's death and wasted critical minutes, the ABC can reveal. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm.

title.children: The 13 critical minutes wasted that could have prevented Cleveland Dodd's death in custody

image.altText: Anthony Albanese meets Xiao Qian

items.synopsis: Chinese Australians and Australian expats in China are upbeat that the long-awaited PM visit may help reverse the "headwind" the relationship has been facing.

title.children: Chinese community hopes PM's visit will move relationship 'in the right direction'

image.altText: A woman with black hair wearing a teal dress smiles.

items.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee promises to spend between $500,000 and $2 million on infrastructure upgrades in each ACT suburb if the Canberra Liberals win the 2024 election, with priority going to older, larger suburbs.

title.children: Hoping to overturn a government in power for 22 years, the Canberra Liberals are going back to basics

image.altText: A large white house with red tiled roof and Indian flag out the front.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court heard Seema Sherghill's duties included cleaning Mavdeep Suri Singh's eight-bedroom home, preparing meals and gardening. She was only allowed to leave the house when she walked the dog.

title.children: Seema Sherghill was forced to work 17.5 hours per day, seven days a week. She was paid just $9 per day

image.altText: A close up shot of a man with white hair wearing a suit.

items.synopsis: A group of high-profile whistleblowers who helped spark royal commissions and change laws write an open letter to the federal government accusing it of overseeing a broken system that leaves whistleblowers exposed to costly legal fees — and worse.

title.children: They risked their livelihoods to speak up, but these whistleblowers are warning others to stay silent

image.altText: A hand holds an iphone showing a Facebook ad showing a photoshopped image of David Koch.

items.synopsis: The words emblazoned across the ads are dramatic, and they're usually accompanied by a photoshopped or AI-generated image of an Australian celebrity being arrested. It's an attempt to take your money.

title.children: Inside the world of fake ad scams stealing the identities of Kochie and celebrities like him around the world

image.altText: Elle McFeast black and white image next to Libbi Gorr, colour photo headshot.

items.synopsis: Libbi Gorr shook up Australian television in the 1990s with her comic character Elle McFeast. A controversial interview saw her TV career tumble. This is how she found her way back.

title.children: 'Beautifully dangerous': Libbi Gorr on the rollercoaster ride of her comic character Elle McFeast

image.altText: A drone and a jet flying through a clear blue sky

items.synopsis: As Israel deploys its fleet of sophisticated, expensive drones in its war against Hamas, the militant group has come armed with its own surprise: Cheap, off-the-shelf-drones rigged up to carry bombs.

title.children: From America's $US56m spy craft to Hamas's 'poor man's air force', Gaza's sky is abuzz with drones

image.altText: A premature baby's hand grips an adult finger. It barely stretches the width of two knuckles.

items.synopsis: Artificial wombs have only been trialled on animals, but recent breakthroughs bring the technology closer for humans. Some experts have expressed ethical concerns.

title.children: Premature birth is the leading cause of death for children aged under five. Could an artificial womb help?

image.altText: Artwork graphic of Zane Duursma, Harley Reid and Ryley Sanders

items.synopsis: The 2023 AFL draft is just around the corner, and a new crop of young guns are ready to make their mark at your club. Here are our rankings of the 30 best talents set to be drafted this year.

title.children: AFL draft top 30 — ranking the best prospects set to take the league by storm

image.altText: Photo of roast meat and vegetables.

items.synopsis: La Trobe University research shows Australians would prefer to embrace many other green options to help the environment before giving up meat and becoming vegetarians.

title.children: Meat-loving Australia has no appetite for vegetarian diet to help planet, study finds

image.altText: two women facing away from the camera leaning on each other in an embrace

items.synopsis: School is the highlight of Brittany's* life, but the Queensland high school student, who has a disability, is rarely there.

title.children: School is the highlight of Brittany's life, but a 'very concerning' trend means she's rarely there

image.altText: A woman looking at an ancient Aboriginal rock carving.

items.synopsis: There are calls for better education about Aboriginal cultural heritage sites after rock carvings dating back thousand of years were vandalised at separate sacred sites in NSW.

title.children: Vandals damage Aboriginal sites older than 'the pyramids of Egypt' on NSW Central Coast

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A jockey clad in black stands in front of a wall featuring a mural of him standing in silks and saluting the crowd.

items.synopsis: Superstar jockey Frankie Dettori flies into Australia today ahead of the race that stops the nation — but racing's Greatest Showman's Melbourne Cup dreams have been dashed again. Andrew McGarry looks at Dettori's career and the latest plot twists in his incredible story.

title.children: Why the Melbourne Cup continues to elude racing's Greatest Showman, Frankie Dettori

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks on stage with a huge TV image of him behind him

items.synopsis: Despite losing the 2020 election to Joe Biden by more than seven million votes, Donald Trump tells a Republican summit near Orlando that he would have won every state if not for widespread voter fraud.

title.children: 'We won every state': Trump ramps up his 2020 US election lies against Biden ahead of New York court appearance

image.altText: An image of the nose of an airplane, behind it is a parked car.

items.synopsis: The hostage situation at Hamburg airport ends with the suspect and his four-year-old daughter exiting a car, police said, after an 18-hour ordeal that closed northern Germany's busiest airport.

title.children: Man arrested after 'hostage situation' closes Hamburg airport

image.altText: Jordan's King Abdullah II and Queen Rania walking in formal wear beside a fence.

items.synopsis: As the war between Israel and Gaza escalates, the conflict is shifting dynamics within the Middle East. In Jordan, the outbreak of violence has evoked longstanding fears the kingdom cannot remain immune to regional instability.

title.children: Why an 'extraordinary' statement by Queen Rania was the first sign of shifting priorities in Jordan

image.altText: A woman holding a horse.

items.synopsis: Jo Pickett's horses have a special job; helping young people with disabilities learn communication and social skills. But due to a wideranging review of safety procedures by Tasmania's education department her small business, and other activity providers, are in limbo due to an indefinite ban.

title.children: Tasmanian business owners 'left in the air' after indefinite public school ban on some outside school activities

image.altText: an offensive poster of adolf hitler holding mask of israeli prime minister benjamin nethanyahu on a road sign

items.synopsis: The posters are the latest in a string of apparent anti-Jewish incidents in Sydney in recent weeks, following the outbreak of the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: Posters in Sydney showing Hitler holding mask of Israeli prime minister's face under police investigation

image.altText: Scott Morrison, Danny Danon and Boris Johnson stand in a line in front of the Israeli flag

items.synopsis: Former PM Scott Morrison flies into Israel to "demonstrate solidarity" with Israel and the Jewish community, as protesters gather outside the Israeli PM's residence to call for his resignation and the immediate release of hostages.

title.children: Morrison flies to Jerusalem as thousands of Israelis call for Netanyahu's resignation

image.altText: A close-up headshot of Ivanka Trump. She wears a red top and silver earrings. Her hand rests on her chin.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump's daughter distanced herself from politics and attempted a reset after her father's election loss. But she's now being forced to testify in his fraud trial, and there's a huge amount at stake.

title.children: Ivanka Trump will follow her father to court. Some observers say he has reason to worry

image.altText: A close-up shot of police tape with police vehicles in the background out of focus.

items.synopsis: A 35-year-old man has been charged with murder after a fatal shooting in the town of Wooroloo, in Perth's east, on Saturday. Police continue the search for two men involved in the incident.

title.children: Man charged with murder after fatal shooting in Perth's east which sent town into lockdown

image.altText: Aerial shot of a rural property in Menah with police vehicles circling on the road

items.synopsis: Eric James Forrest, 33, was arrested in Sydney on Sunday after David Collisson was reported missing in central west NSW last month.

title.children: 'In cold blood': NSW man charged with murder after bones discovered in tree trunk

image.altText: A fire truck drives towards a tree that is engulfed in flames

items.synopsis: WA's emergency services minister says it is likely fire crews will be able to control bushfires burning south of Perth over the coming days, while an emergency warning remains in place for Serpentine.

title.children: Lives and homes still under threat by fire south of Perth, as firefighters battle several blazes

image.altText: new southw ales premier chris minns standing next to transport m inister jo haylen as she speaks into media microphones

items.synopsis: Embattled NSW Transport Minister Jo Haylen says she will not resign, even if a public servant who worked in her office is found to have breached his obligation to act politically neutral.

title.children: 'Staffer rorts 101': NSW transport minister won't resign, premier doubles down on support

image.altText: A blue F1 car, spinning on track, damaged, about to drive into barriers

items.synopsis: Formula 1's São Paulo Grand Prix has been stopped on lap 1 after a big crash at the opening corner.

title.children: Verstappen survives chaotic start, race stoppage, to win as Aussies cruelled by lap 1 crash

image.altText: A female footballer player lies on the ground after injuring her knee.

items.synopsis: Season-ending knee injuries are becoming common among female athletes in Australia's football codes, leaving medical experts  increasingly concerned with the rise in this trend.

title.children: 'Australia is about to see a tsunami of ACL injuries' warns surgeon who fixed Ellie Carpenter's knee

image.altText: a bag filled with polystyrene beads

items.synopsis: The local environmental group has described the spill as a "pollution event of an industrial scale".

title.children: Thousands of plastic beads wash up on Sunshine Coast beaches days into turtle nesting season

image.altText: The front of an old church. The main body of the church is missing after being burned down.

items.synopsis: Deserted churches can be found across Australia as monuments to a bygone era. But not all deconsecrated holy places are destined for a lonely, forgotten existence.

title.children: Exploring Australia's forgotten churches, and their weird and wonderful new uses
